intro: Cacalia peucedanifolia, commonly known as the European cow-weed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in meadows, roadsides, and other disturbed soils. Cacalia peucedanifolia is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
